WRITING.TEXT: Let's be fair. Hakeem out played David in that series by a pretty wide margin. David didn't play poorly. He just wasn't as good as Hakeem was for that stretch. Hakeem averaged 35.3ppg, 12.5rpg, 5apg, 1.3 spg, and 4.2 bpg. David had 23.8ppg, 11.3rpg, 2.7apg, 1.5spg, and 2.2 bpg. Sean, Avery, and Vinny gave as much as Clyde, Horry, and Cassell gave the Rockets in that series. I think David would even admit that he was out played in that [series](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hW4uXlRGAF0).

The simple, perhaps cheap, explanation is that this was a decision made by the redactor of Matthew. I agree. Matthew is originally a Jewish-Christian gospel.
The fingerprints of a factional dispute are all over. For instance, Peter is given the keys to the kingdom of heaven in 16:9. Then in chapter 18:18-20 they are given to all of the disciples. I tend to believe contradictions like that are the result of a dispute concerning apostolic succession. Similarly, Matthew 27:25 seems like interpolation added to *sanitize* the gospel.
This sub has him as a top ten all time center, so it depends where you go. He's a polarizing figure in terms of how people rank him for whatever reason.
The Chris has facilitated this sub's full turn against him. He is no longer this sub's boy.
He's a classical human being. I'm in.
I've questioned Pop's ability to adjust for probably over a decade now. I'm more interested in what the small ball line up you are referring to is.

I'm biased, but I like him at number one. Against the pack, he's number two. Our guy is special. When he goes up against Lebron, he seems to edge him most of the time, especially as of late. He's clutch. It would be a dream to see them match up in the finals to really answer that question.
I felt taller than him when I was standing next to him. I'm just a tad under 6 feet tall.
I agree. The numbers just aren't there. And for that reason, I'm out.

I feel like Draymond has to be one of the key ingredients in whatever dessert is made. At least make him the [cream](http://i.imgur.com/c4j0WLa.jpg). KD is the [cherry](http://i.imgur.com/YhfnmAW.jpg).

Or, if you're Todd Grisham, scalp harvest.

I'd, too, like one.
...for free?
I think it's because I haven't opened my box of Duncan O's.
Bro...we don't talk about this stuff. Shh. Delete this fam.

He needs to be more aggressive. This could be his last playoff series. If he is healthy enough to play, he needs to be finding a way to get to the basket. If he can get a lay-up, something easier, he can get confidence and his legs under him. Until I see that, I'd rather see those shots go else where. The question becomes who. I think the three ball has to fall for us to win a game. Let's hope is happens again at home.

LA aside, I think Timmy changes this series. We miss him. I'd take Timmy off the couch right now. Back to LA. He is being asked to do a lot defensively. It seems he has opted, or Pop rather, to concentrate more energy on Gasol and Z-Bo. Boxing those guys out, playing hard on defense, is going impact stat lines and offensive output. Still, I don't think we are getting the value we expected. It looks worse in the absence of Timmy.
**Giovanni's Room** is one of the best book I've ever read. Just hearing that you're going to read it soon brightened up my day.
I just finished **The Setting Sun**, by Osamu Dazai. It was the third book I've read by Dazai. Just like the others, I left feeling a little bit more depressed than I went in.
The future can't come soon enough.
If you thought it was an easy sweep, I'm sorry.
Jesus Christ...don't worry, this guy is not a real fan. Move on. Nothing to see here.

WRITING.TITLE: 94 ovr looking for league
WRITING.TEXT: I want to join a league where people play all their quarters in tournaments and win.
Or its the accumulation of being punched in the face a ton of times for his whole career.
First it was me. Then it was Spurs fans. Now it's the sub. I think it's time to admit you were wrong and move on.
Which doesn't mean anything when Green goes 0-6 from three. He's been cold all year.
Oh, thank you for the proof. I really see your point of view now.

Please tell me about how good everyone else on the team is. I'm not saying they suck, but they are an average team if Kawhi is not on the team. Mediocre means average, and that's what I think they are. The second best player on the Spurs played over 40 minutes and had 13 points and 2 rebounds. Who can they rely on besides Kawhi? I've watched every game this season. If you disagree with me, offer proof.

It's basically been this way all season. No one has done more with less. We just assume he has more because a lot of these guys on the Spurs use to be good, and the Spurs are all about a team concept. Nope. It's all Kawhi.
He's out there by himself. I don't think you guys fully appreciate how mediocre the rest of the team is.

Couple of things, bud. You're making yourself look bad. The context is there for anyone to see. You deleted the Kawhi post, so it makes it hard to put that in context. Here's the full Pop post:https://www.reddit.com/r/nba/comments/5zhs5p/spurs_future_post_pop/
Also, I think you are misinterpreting the word karma. Karma refers to one's actions coming back to decide a future fate. When you use that word, you are basically saying that some ill action committed by the Spurs will come back to make them a terrible team. Under the proper use of the word, the Spurs got a lot of good karma coming. Now, since I don't take people's words out of context, I don't think you mean that. What you are trying to say is that, you think the Spurs' luck will run out. The problem is--and with you track record it is augmented--that you have no real reason to say you think the Spurs will suck other than a hunch. Pop is one guy. He's a great coach, but to make a statement like that is completely discounting the job Holt, RC, and others have done in the organization.

Me too. Leif is a great character and deserves to be developed more.
I'm enjoying this show as much as anything that's on tv right now.

I've tagged you every time you said something like this:
I really believe we will be the worst team in the NBA for a while in the coming years.
It's not false accusations. It's not me searching. You're one of three people I have tagged on all of reddit. Every time you say something anti-spurs and I go to tag you, I realize I've already tagged you. Its crazy.
Edit: Btw, the Kawhi post was last month. And you really must not think highly of Kawhi, who is 25 years old, if you think the Spurs will be the worst team in the NBA for most of his career.

You post dumb shit all the time. For instance, you have whole thread devoted to how terrible the Spurs are going to be when Pop leaves. I feel like you have more posts about other teams on here than the Spurs, and you regularly post anti-Spur sentiments on r/NBA. I really don't know where your loyalties lie.
Yes, I'm taking Memphis seriously. I've watched all the games we've played against them this year (I've watched all the Spurs games). Last night wasn't an anomaly. The Spurs are more than capable of laying 3 more eggs in this series. They are also capable of blowing them out the rest of the series. This team is like that. What's more, while you are busy rooting for other teams, you are forgetting that OKC eliminated us last year. You can say it had everything to do with Durant and that they are not the same team, but the big reason we lost was due to OKC athleticism. It is a problem we would still face in an OKC series. They've beat us more times than we've beat them this year. Who do you think Pop is rooting for? My guess is the Spurs. He, like me, realizes that the Spurs are going to have to beat the best teams to win a championship.

What a surprise, this guy (the one who said Kawhi is overrated and other questionable things) wants us to upvote OKC in the Spurs forum. Are we really going to overlook Memphis after what happened last night? How about a Spurs upvote party, so we can beat Memphis first. This series is 2-1, and honestly Memphis has the momentum. How many series' have we seen where the other team makes a big adjustment, such as putting Randolph in the starting line up and spreading the floor like they did last night, and the Spurs don't have an answer for it. I won't feel comfortable until the Spurs answer back after last nights game. And I'm certainly not confident enough to start rooting for another team.

Yeah. I love Kyle. He owned Vince in that situation and Vince, a veteran, should have realized what was going on. He got him fired up by getting physical with him and then let Vince escalate it himself. Salty Grizz fans are talking about Vince getting t'd up for trash talking "a baby." No, he got t'd up for letting "a baby" get into his head.

He implied that Conley was not getting calls because he's humble and quiet...so why is Kawhi getting calls? If you are acting like you are being discriminated, there must be something you have that the other team doesn't have that is causing to be discriminated. Does that make sense? He is claiming Conley is being discriminated. To make that argument, that your not getting calls because of the low key personality of one of your players, when you are complaining about the most humble team in the NBA getting a bunch of calls, just sounds like a really poor and confused argument.

The refs aren't the reason we lost, and they're not the reason we went down by 26. But they're sure as HELL the reason we couldn't complete the comeback.
TIL the refs aren't the reason the Grizzlies lost, just the reason they didn't come back and win.
It's because Conley is a humble, quiet guy who gets no respect. When you contrast that with the delinquent Spurs, no wonder Conley isn't getting any calls. The NBA loves bad boys. SMH.

Number of FTA doesn't mean shit.
This is the problem I'm having. How does saying the other team shot way more free throws than you proof that you weren't getting calls? It's not! It's actually embarrassing that people are behaving like he presented slam dunk evidence. As far as I know, there's not a rule that says the NBA has to make sure that each team gets the same number of free throws. If one team is fouling more, they are going to get more calls! How about the fact that Memphis is second in the entire NBA in average fouls committed per game. Now, that's a relevant stat! How about the fact that they are having a real tough time guarding Kawhi when they are not fouling him. Look at his field goal percentage. It's not surprising that they are getting more physical with him in an effort to stop him, but it's not working. Were there some questionable calls? Sure. But that is almost always the case in an NBA game. They could have got a few more calls. But to act like that would have swayed the game is disingenuous at best.

If the Spurs are going to win the championship, they are going to have to beat the best teams in the NBA. I don't care who wins, as long as the Spurs win. If the question was: who do the Spurs match up better against? But asking who should I be rooting for? Maybe I'd gloss over something like that if I didn't see so much questionable fandom on here.

When you also consider the fact that they were those two finals wins away from being considered a dynasty, his comment becomes even more absurd. They were perennial contenders in the 90s. They made the conference finals four times over that period. Outside of the Bulls, there was no team in the east as consistently good as the Knicks over that period of time. The Bull eliminated them five times. It's safe to say they probably would have got some titles if it were not for the Bulls.

The Knicks made the playoffs 13 times in a row within those 30 years. They advanced 11 out of those 13 times. You can't say nearly and then cut off half the number. They didn't make the playoff 12 of the last 30 years. 12 is not nearly 30. The 12 isn't consecutive either.

Don't listen to anything this guy says. He suffers from the Dunning-Kruger effect. He's been on reddit for 2 years and has negative comment karma--the definition of a troll. It was purely random on one day of the entire event. The second day you got a sure fire 93 Rodman. The first day you got a HOTM player. The third day was far more random.
From what I've read, presents increased in value throughout that winter promo, and the final day was among (if not) the largest. It is fair to guess that the final day would be the largest, but it is a guess. I've accumulated three of these baskets. I'm going to hold onto them. EA is capable of pulling the rug out on you, so it is a gamble. In my mind, if you want to gamble for Sunday, it would have been wiser to buy the eggs on 4/13, as they went down due to a lot of people losing coins on wonderous baskets that day. People are incredibly reactionary, so take advantage of it. If they are worth anything on that day, the price is going to shoot up immediately, so you won't really profit. That is one of the few smart things OiGee ever said.

Yes, fair. There are multiple things at play here. For one, that is not how the baskets worked on the first two days. You were guaranteed to retain some value, so whether it was intentional or not, expectation was set. There was absolutely zero randomness on the day prior. On the first day, you were just about guaranteed a value of 1,000,000+ coins. The difference of value between the baskets on day 1 and 2 compared to day 3 is approximately 800,000 coins for a large number of people! What's more, usually when games like these are played, the player at most stands to lose 50% of their investment. Losing between 80-90% of your investment, and this not being rare from what other people said, is ridiculous. These are two valid reasons for anyone to be upset.
In any field where expectation is set by a provider and then that provider literally pulls the rugs out from you, even in games of chance, people are going to be upset. You taught the clientele that the loss potential was not high, only to make it extremely high after expectation has been set. My personal loss was almost total. If EA had given any indication to the player that they stood to lose nearly their entire investment, lots of people would have not played. The problem is that EA did just the opposite. They gave people low/no-stakes gambling on the first two days, and high stakes gambling on the third. It's disingenuous. It's shady. It's unfair.

I got an 84 and an 85. My guess is the value is 80-100K right now. You can't convince me that is fair. The eggs have never been that low, when you consider it takes two elite trophies to get the collectible for one egg. No matter how you slice it, eggs were always going to cost a minimum of 35-40,000. You need 10. 400,000 min for two elites that are sub 90 is a massive rip off, especially when you consider that the other days had a significantly higher value. EA also has to assume to value and cost for bronze players, gold players, and elite trophies all go up considerably when you demand exponentially more of them without increasing the supply. It's a rip off, period. OP has every reason to feel salty about his luck.
Yup. We went full retard. This sub is now populated by children. I'm out.
I called it, but no one gives me a pat on the back, and I remind everyone I told all the time. :'(
It certainly has had elements of that for the 3+ years I've been on here. It's gotten [absolutely disgusting](http://i.imgur.com/yqWi7gC.jpg) over time.
It's not news that he reaches his hand out on purpose. Was someone questioning whether he intentionally reaches his hand out on purpose? We've always known he does that to measure distance.

Opinions are so monolithic on this sub. It wasn't always the case. I'm not defending Jon Jones. Whether you disagree with his actions or him as a person, it has nothing to do with the guy admitting to intentionally poking people in the eyes. If he did do that, I want to see it. The echo-chamber has become strong enough that, if we decide we dislike someone, we will be disingenuous about what we report as facts concerning that person. We are literally the west wing of reddit with facts.

All the eye-pokes he's acknowledged that he does on purpose
Jones admitted he sticks his fingers out intentionally to hurt his opponents? I'm genuinely asking as I don't recall him -- or anyone else for that matter -- actually admit this.
but to say I am purposely poking people in the eye it's just inaccurate.
Ok...tell me what I missed.

Wow. I'm fully convinced that this sub has gone full retard. The guy literally says it's unintentional at the end of this clip. He never once says he intentionally pokes people in the eyes... Come on people. I feel like this sub has lost track of the line between opinion and fact.
It's absolutely disgusting!
